description: The central valley of California produces a quarter of the nation's food. How are farmworkers dealing with an intense, long-lasting heatwave sweeping the interior of the state?
title: Central Valley, where 1/4 of U.S.'s food is grown, faces extreme heat for a 2nd week

description: Sen. J.D. Vance, R-Ohio, who once called former Donald Trump “America’s Hitler” but is now one of his most vocal supporters in Congress, has been named Trump’s 2024 vice presidential pick. Here's where he stands on key issues.
title: Where J.D. Vance stands on key issues

description: There are no identified ties between the shooter, Thomas Matthew Crooks, and any foreign or domestic accomplices or co-conspirators. But Iranian threats against Trump officials date back to the killing of Qassem Soleimani.
title: NSC warned Secret Service about an increased Iranian threat to Trump

description: One of tonight's scheduled speakers is Savannah Chrisley. Her parents, Todd and Julie, were accused of funding their lavish lifestyle through dishonest means, and in June 2022 were found guilty on federal charges including bank fraud and tax evasion.
title: Reality star Savannah Chrisley will speak tonight, likely about her incarcerated parents

description: The Republican National Convention opened last night with an unlikely prime time speaker: Sean O’Brien, president of the Teamsters union. His appearance has the labor movement riled up.
title: The labor movement and the presidential election

description: Spain won the European Championship for soccer this year. NPR's Juana Summers talks with The Athletic senior writer Felipe Cardenas about the news and what it means.
title: Where does the U.S. Men's Soccer team go after Gregg Berhalter's firing?

description: The RNC will adapt a platform that includes a chapter with two pillars: “Sealing the border and stopping the migrant invasion and Carrying out the largest deportation operation in America History.”
title: Biden’s approach to immigration is under fire at the RNC today

description: In Hong Kong, long after the protest movement that kicked off five years ago fizzled out, a quiet tussle is playing out over the fate of businesses that once supported the ideals of the demonstrators.
title: Hong Kong businesses are under threat for association with pro-democracy protests

description: There's still no clear motive in the attempted assassination of president Donald Trump. But experts say it will be a defining moment as America grapples with rising political violence.
title: It's still unclear how politics factor into the Trump assassination attempt

description:
Ever since the Hamas attacks on Israel on October 7th, Israel had detained thousands of Palestinians from Gaza. We hear the story of one radiologist who says he endured beatings and mistreatment during seven months in Israeli detention.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: A Gaza Detainee Speaks

description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with David Frum, a senior editor for The Atlantic, to dig a little deeper into J.D. Vance’s political path. Frum knew the politician and wrote a piece about him in 2022.
title: Charting J.D. Vance's journey from 'never Trump' to Trump's running mate

description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with political historian Matthew Dallek on the link between rhetoric and political violence, and the history of political violence in the United States.
title: Despite appeals for peace, the U.S. has a long history of political violence

description: As hundreds of thousands of migrants reach the United States' southern border every month, many hold onto traditions like coming-of-age ceremonies to give them a sense of home.
title: How one Mexican immigrant works to honor traditions across borders

description: A New York City jury convicted the New Jersey Democrat of accepting bribes to benefit businessmen in his home state and the governments of Egypt and Qatar.
title: Democratic Sen. Menendez found guilty in bribery trial

description: A leaked video of a phone call between third-party candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and Donald Trump shows the former president expressing doubt about vaccines.
title: Leaked video shows Trump criticizing vaccines on phone with RFK Jr.

description: Just in time for the All-Star Game, pop culture critic and Phillies fan Linda Holmes is here to persuade you to turn on some baseball. If you don't have a team, just borrow hers; they're doing pretty well.
title: Looking for a comfort watch? Turn on baseball, our pop culture critic says

description: Former President Donald Trump has selected Sen. J.D. Vance of Ohio as his running mate for the presidential election. Here’s more about him. And, a sultry R&B song about heat pumps.
title: Who is J.D. Vance, Trump’s VP pick? And, an R&B jam addresses climate change

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Caroline Sunshine, deputy communications director for the Trump campaign, about the convention and if the assassination attempt on ex-President Trump changed its plans.
title: On Day 1 of the RNC, Trump announced he picked Sen. J.D. Vance as his running mate

description: In recent history, labor unions overwhelmingly back Democrats. President Biden calls himself the most pro-union president ever. But at the RNC, the head of the teamsters had a prime speaking slot.
title: Teamsters President Sean O'Brien addresses the Republican National Convention

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Jonah Goldberg, editor and co-founder of The Dispatch, about the choice of Vance, who once described former President Trump using words like “idiot” and “Hitler.”
title: Former President Trump chooses Sen. J.D. Vance of Ohio as his running mate

description: U.S. Palestinians are helping their families evacuate, rebuild, and buy basics like food.
title: A Palestinian American raises more than $1 million to feed his family and others in Gaza

description: The Education Department is handling record numbers of discrimination cases, including those involving disability. The backlog leaves some families waiting for help.
title: As discrimination complaints soar, parents of disabled students wait for help

description: Cal Fire Chief Joe Tyler said the agency and its partners are equipped with with fire trucks, bulldozers, and newly introduced Blackhawk helicopters that can fly at night.
title: California’s wildfires are burning far more land so far this year than in 2023

description: Cities across the country are using billions of dollars in federal funding to make streets safer. But in some places, that’s accelerating conflict with local residents who don’t like the changes.
title: Federal dollars speed up work on safe streets, but money isn’t the only roadblock

description: Even when patients double-check that their care is covered by insurance, health providers may send them bills as they haggle with insurers over reimbursement. It's stressful and annoying — but legal.
title: Her hearing implant was preapproved. But she still received multiple $139,000 bills

description: In a peaceful protest in Milwaukee, progressive activists tried to send the Republican Party a message of resistance to a potential second Trump presidency.
title: Progressives try to send a message of resistance through the RNC security barrier

description: NPR staff and contributors share their favorite video games of 2024 so far.
title: The best games of 2024 so far, picked by the NPR staff

description: Republicans hope to return Wisconsin to former President Donald Trump in November. While they hope the RNC can deliver resources, they are also building a ground game to engage voters new voters.
title: Wisconsin Republicans have a plan for engaging new voters

description: A radiologist in Gaza tells NPR he endured beatings and mistreatment during seven months in Israeli detention. Israel has incarcerated thousands of Gazans since the Oct. 7 Hamas attack.
title: A radiologist in Gaza says he endured beatings while detained in Israel

description: Phoenix wants to reduce the number of deaths from extreme heat. One strategy is to provide chilled water in public spaces.
title: Phoenix aims to save lives with chilled water fountains for public use

description: U.S. District Judge Aileen Cannon’s dismissed Jack Smith’s documents case against Donald Trump. What legal options does the special counsel now have?
title: Judge Cannon dismisses Trump documents case over special counsel appointment

description: The Secret Service is facing sharp questions and criticism in the wake of the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump.
title: Attempted assassination of Donald Trump puts Secret Service into harsh spotlight

description: After 34 years, the iconic Mirage casino and hotel on the Las Vegas strip will close Wednesday. It will reopen in 2027 as a Hard Rock Hotel & Casino and Guitar Hotel Las Vegas.
title: Get there while you can: The Mirage in Las Vegas will be closing its doors in 1 day

description: Republicans adopted a new platform at their party’s convention in Milwaukee. One of the most-watched sections has been the language around abortion rights.
title: How language around abortion rights features in the new Republican Party platform

description: Donald Trump picks Senator J.D. Vance of Ohio as his vice presidential nominee. The Secret Service is under fire after the attempt on Trump's life. After pausing his campaign, Biden heads to Nevada.
title: Morning news brief

description: The law, which is the first in the nation, bans school rules requiring school staff to disclose a student's gender identity or sexual orientation to any other person without the child's permission.
title: California bans school rules requiring parents notification of child's pronoun change
